db:abstract.db:para: The QQuaternion class represents a quaternion consisting of a vector and scalar.

db:listitem.db:para: QQuaternion is part of Rendering in 3D

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Quaternions are used to represent rotations in 3D space, and consist of a 3D rotation axis specified by the x, y, and z coordinates, and a scalar representing the rotation angle.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion::QQuaternion()
db:section.db:para: Constructs an identity quaternion (1, 0, 0, 0), i.e. with the vector (0, 0, 0) and scalar 1.

db:section.db:title: [explicit constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion::QQuaternion(const QVector4D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a quaternion from the components of vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion::QQuaternion(float scalar, const QVector3D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a quaternion vector from the specified vector and scalar.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion::QQuaternion(float scalar, float xpos, float ypos, float zpos)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a quaternion with the vector (xpos, ypos, zpos) and scalar.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion QQuaternion::conjugated() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the conjugate of this quaternion, which is (-x, -y, -z, scalar).

db:section.db:title: [static constexpr noexcept] float QQuaternion::dotProduct(const QQuaternion &q1, const QQuaternion &q2)
db:section.db:para: Returns the dot product of q1 and q2.

db:section.db:title: [static] QQuaternion QQuaternion::fromAxes(const QVector3D &xAxis, const QVector3D &yAxis, const QVector3D &zAxis)
db:section.db:para: Constructs the quaternion using 3 axes (xAxis, yAxis, zAxis).

db:note.db:para: The axes are assumed to be orthonormal.

db:section.db:title: [static] QQuaternion QQuaternion::fromAxisAndAngle(const QVector3D &axis, float angle)
db:section.db:para: Creates a normalized quaternion that corresponds to rotating through angle degrees about the specified 3D axis.

db:section.db:title: [static] QQuaternion QQuaternion::fromAxisAndAngle(float x, float y, float z, float angle)
db:section.db:para: Creates a normalized quaternion that corresponds to rotating through angle degrees about the 3D axis (x, y, z).

db:section.db:title: [static] QQuaternion QQuaternion::fromDirection(const QVector3D &direction, const QVector3D &up)
db:section.db:para: Constructs the quaternion using specified forward direction direction and upward direction up. If the upward direction was not specified or the forward and upward vectors are collinear, a new orthonormal upward direction will be generated.

db:section.db:title: [static] QQuaternion QQuaternion::fromEulerAngles(float pitch, float yaw, float roll)
db:section.db:para: Creates a quaternion that corresponds to a rotation of roll degrees around the z axis, pitch degrees around the x axis, and yaw degrees around the y axis (in that order).

db:section.db:title: [static] QQuaternion QQuaternion::fromEulerAngles(const QVector3D &eulerAngles)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.

Creates a quaternion that corresponds to a rotation of eulerAngles: eulerAngles.z() degrees around the z axis, eulerAngles.x() degrees around the x axis, and eulerAngles.y() degrees around the y axis (in that order).

db:section.db:title: [static] QQuaternion QQuaternion::fromRotationMatrix(const QMatrix3x3 &rot3x3)
db:section.db:para: Creates a quaternion that corresponds to a rotation matrix rot3x3.

db:note.db:para: If a given rotation matrix is not normalized, the resulting quaternion will contain scaling information.

db:section.db:title: void QQuaternion::getAxes(QVector3D *xAxis, QVector3D *yAxis, QVector3D *zAxis) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 3 orthonormal axes (xAxis, yAxis, zAxis) defining the quaternion.

db:section.db:title: void QQuaternion::getAxisAndAngle(float *x, float *y, float *z, float *angle) const
db:section.db:para: Extracts a 3D axis (x, y, z) and a rotating angle angle (in degrees) that corresponds to this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: void QQuaternion::getAxisAndAngle(QVector3D *axis, float *angle) const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Extracts a 3D axis axis and a rotating angle angle (in degrees) that corresponds to this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: void QQuaternion::getEulerAngles(float *pitch, float *yaw, float *roll) const
db:section.db:para: Calculates roll, pitch, and yaw Euler angles (in degrees) that corresponds to this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion QQuaternion::inverted() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the inverse of this quaternion. If this quaternion is null, then a null quaternion is returned.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool QQuaternion::isIdentity() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the x, y, and z components of this quaternion are set to 0.0, and the scalar component is set to 1.0; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool QQuaternion::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the x, y, z, and scalar components of this quaternion are set to 0.0; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: float QQuaternion::length() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the length of the quaternion. This is also called the "norm".

db:section.db:title: float QQuaternion::lengthSquared() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the squared length of the quaternion.

db:note.db:para: Though cheap to compute, this is susceptible to overflow and underflow that length() avoids in many cases.

db:section.db:title: [static] QQuaternion QQuaternion::nlerp(const QQuaternion &q1, const QQuaternion &q2, float t)
db:section.db:para: Interpolates along the shortest linear path between the rotational positions q1 and q2. The value t should be between 0 and 1, indicating the distance to travel between q1 and q2. The result will be normalized().
If t is less than or equal to 0, then q1 will be returned. If t is greater than or equal to 1, then q2 will be returned.
The nlerp() function is typically faster than slerp() and will give approximate results to spherical interpolation that are good enough for some applications.

db:section.db:title: void QQuaternion::normalize()
db:section.db:para: Normalizes the current quaternion in place. Nothing happens if this is a null quaternion or the length of the quaternion is very close to 1.

db:section.db:title: QQuaternion QQuaternion::normalized() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the normalized unit form of this quaternion.

If this quaternion is null, then a null quaternion is returned. If the length of the quaternion is very close to 1, then the quaternion will be returned as-is. Otherwise the normalized form of the quaternion of length 1 will be returned.

db:section.db:title: [static] QQuaternion QQuaternion::rotationTo(const QVector3D &from, const QVector3D &to)
db:section.db:para: Returns the shortest arc quaternion to rotate from the direction described by the vector from to the direction described by the vector to.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] float QQuaternion::scalar() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the scalar component of this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] void QQuaternion::setScalar(float scalar)
db:section.db:para: Sets the scalar component of this quaternion to scalar.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] void QQuaternion::setVector(const QVector3D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Sets the vector component of this quaternion to vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] void QQuaternion::setVector(float x, float y, float z)
db:section.db:para: Sets the vector component of this quaternion to (x, y, z).

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] void QQuaternion::setX(float x)
db:section.db:para: Sets the x coordinate of this quaternion's vector to the given x coordinate.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] void QQuaternion::setY(float y)
db:section.db:para: Sets the y coordinate of this quaternion's vector to the given y coordinate.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] void QQuaternion::setZ(float z)
db:section.db:para: Sets the z coordinate of this quaternion's vector to the given z coordinate.

db:section.db:title: [static] QQuaternion QQuaternion::slerp(const QQuaternion &q1, const QQuaternion &q2, float t)
db:section.db:para: Interpolates along the shortest spherical path between the rotational positions q1 and q2. The value t should be between 0 and 1, indicating the spherical distance to travel between q1 and q2.
If t is less than or equal to 0, then q1 will be returned. If t is greater than or equal to 1, then q2 will be returned.

db:section.db:title: QVector3D QQuaternion::toEulerAngles() const
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Calculates roll, pitch, and yaw Euler angles (in degrees) that corresponds to this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: QMatrix3x3 QQuaternion::toRotationMatrix() const
db:section.db:para: Creates a rotation matrix that corresponds to this quaternion.

db:note.db:para: If this quaternion is not normalized, the resulting rotation matrix will contain scaling information.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QVector4D QQuaternion::toVector4D() const
db:section.db:para: Returns this quaternion as a 4D vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QVector3D QQuaternion::vector() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the vector component of this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] float QQuaternion::x() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the x coordinate of this quaternion's vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] float QQuaternion::y() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the y coordinate of this quaternion's vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] float QQuaternion::z() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the z coordinate of this quaternion's vector.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QQuaternion::operator QVariant() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the quaternion as a QVariant.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion &QQuaternion::operator*=(const QQuaternion &quaternion)
db:section.db:para: Multiplies this quaternion by quaternion and returns a reference to this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion &QQuaternion::operator*=(float factor)
db:section.db:para: Multiplies this quaternion's components by the given factor, and returns a reference to this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion &QQuaternion::operator+=(const QQuaternion &quaternion)
db:section.db:para: Adds the given quaternion to this quaternion and returns a reference to this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion &QQuaternion::operator-=(const QQuaternion &quaternion)
db:section.db:para: Subtracts the given quaternion from this quaternion and returns a reference to this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QQuaternion &QQuaternion::operator/=(float divisor)
db:section.db:para: Divides this quaternion's components by the given divisor, and returns a reference to this quaternion.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool qFuzzyCompare(const QQuaternion &q1, const QQuaternion &q2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if q1 and q2 are equal, allowing for a small fuzziness factor for floating-point comparisons; false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool operator!=(const QQuaternion &q1, const QQuaternion &q2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if q1 is not equal to q2; otherwise returns false. This operator uses an exact floating-point comparison.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion operator*(const QQuaternion &q1, const QQuaternion &q2)
db:section.db:para: Multiplies q1 and q2 using quaternion multiplication. The result corresponds to applying both of the rotations specified by q1 and q2.

db:section.db:title: QVector3D operator*(const QQuaternion &quaternion, const QVector3D &vec)
db:section.db:para: Rotates a vector vec with a quaternion quaternion to produce a new vector in 3D space.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion operator*(const QQuaternion &quaternion, float factor)
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of the given quaternion, multiplied by the given factor.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion operator*(float factor, const QQuaternion &quaternion)
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of the given quaternion, multiplied by the given factor.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion operator+(const QQuaternion &q1, const QQuaternion &q2)
db:section.db:para: Returns a QQuaternion object that is the sum of the given quaternions, q1 and q2; each component is added separately.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion operator-(const QQuaternion &quaternion)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns a QQuaternion object that is formed by changing the sign of all three components of the given quaternion.
Equivalent to QQuaternion(0,0,0,0) - quaternion.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] QQuaternion operator-(const QQuaternion &q1, const QQuaternion &q2)
db:section.db:para: Returns a QQuaternion object that is formed by subtracting q2 from q1; each component is subtracted separately.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QQuaternion operator/(const QQuaternion &quaternion, float divisor)
db:section.db:para: Returns the QQuaternion object formed by dividing all components of the given quaternion by the given divisor.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator<<(QDataStream &stream, const QQuaternion &quaternion)
db:section.db:para: Writes the given quaternion to the given stream and returns a reference to the stream.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr noexcept] bool operator==(const QQuaternion &q1, const QQuaternion &q2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if q1 is equal to q2; otherwise returns false. This operator uses an exact floating-point comparison.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator>>(QDataStream &stream, QQuaternion &quaternion)
db:section.db:para: Reads a quaternion from the given stream into the given quaternion and returns a reference to the stream.
